Example.Name: USART_HyperTerminalInterrupt
Example.Description:
This example provides a description of how to use the EVAL_COM1 when using the STM32303C-EVAL Transmit and Receive interrupts to communicate with the hyperterminal.
First, the EVAL_COM1 sends the TxBuffer to the hyperterminal and still waiting for a string from the hyperterminal that you must enter.The string that you have entered is stored in the RxBuffer array. The receive buffer have a RxBufferSize bytes as maximum (the reception is stopped when this maximum receive value is reached).
The EVAL_COM1 is configured as follow: - BaudRate = 9600 baud - Word Length = 8 Bits (7 data bit + 1 parity bit) - Two Stop Bit - Odd parity - Hardware flow control disabled (RTS and CTS signals) - Receive and transmit enabled
